<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// while having IEEE non-finite behavior is liable to lead to unexpected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// results.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180">fltNanEncoding</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Represents the standard IEEE behavior where a value is NaN if its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exponent is all 1s and the significand is non-zero.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a472abfae8142fdb6f39d081303e8af85"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a472abfae8142fdb6f39d081303e8af85">IEEE</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Represents the behavior in the Float8E4M3FN floating point type where NaN</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is represented by having the exponent and mantissa set to all 1s.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This behavior matches the FP8 E4M3 type described in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.05433. We treat both signed and unsigned NaNs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as non-signalling, although the paper does not state whether the NaN</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// values are signalling or not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a421c6b20238e6e6585270538188f15b9"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a421c6b20238e6e6585270538188f15b9">AllOnes</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Represents the behavior in Float8E&#123;5,4&#125;E&#123;2,3&#125;FNUZ floating point types</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where NaN is represented by a sign bit of 1 and all 0s in the exponent</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and mantissa (i.e. the negative zero encoding in a IEEE float). Since</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there is only one NaN value, it is treated as quiet NaN. This matches the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// behavior described in https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.02915 .</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a062a7e7a762600c65f4435eb53a6f17a"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a062a7e7a762600c65f4435eb53a6f17a">NegativeZero</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Represents floating point arithmetic semantics.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics">fltSemantics</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; The largest E such that 2^E is representable; this matches the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">     definition of IEEE 754  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a259e56c00894bdd3606974a6e3a6464e"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#afe80c9bd1684d47025d691a7eabcb656">APFloatBase::ExponentType</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a259e56c00894bdd3606974a6e3a6464e">maxExponent</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; The smallest E such that 2^E is a normalized number; this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">     matches the definition of IEEE 754  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a775c20ec722ff6779370b64d2251d954"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#afe80c9bd1684d47025d691a7eabcb656">APFloatBase::ExponentType</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a775c20ec722ff6779370b64d2251d954">minExponent</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Number of bits in the significand.  This includes the integer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">     bit.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#aaec0dd351f93ebc840a6551422c2ad97"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#aaec0dd351f93ebc840a6551422c2ad97">precision</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Number of bits actually used in the semantics. &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a8bca650e08800ab5625649c4f991b909"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a8bca650e08800ab5625649c4f991b909">sizeInBits</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a627fc7f98b788a5ed6da4856a414736b"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab0b9d2d0eaa773cc9476c1cd7a728b3e">fltNonfiniteBehavior</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a627fc7f98b788a5ed6da4856a414736b">nonFiniteBehavior</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab0b9d2d0eaa773cc9476c1cd7a728b3eaac6a6b8a25c5c9332dcd09a9ebd672ac">fltNonfiniteBehavior::IEEE754</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#ad7ec63ba9c1917d7432329b8ab00e3b0"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180">fltNanEncoding</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#ad7ec63ba9c1917d7432329b8ab00e3b0">nanEncoding</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a472abfae8142fdb6f39d081303e8af85">fltNanEncoding::IEEE</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Whether this semantics has an encoding for Zero &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#ab3820f5dd38e5f39bca385d6a39d1779"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#ab3820f5dd38e5f39bca385d6a39d1779">hasZero</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Whether this semantics can represent signed values &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a82ebbe1ed81fa4ae7185176f7c8c3463"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/fltsemantics/#a82ebbe1ed81fa4ae7185176f7c8c3463">hasSignedRepr</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; A tight upper bound on number of parts required to hold the value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">   pow(5, power) is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="comment">     power &#42; 815 / (351 &#42; integerPartWidth) + 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="comment">   However, whilst the result may require only this many parts,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="comment">   because we are multiplying two values to get it, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">   multiplication may require an extra part with the excess part</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">   being zero (consider the trivial case of 1 &#42; 1, tcFullMultiply</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">   requires two parts to hold the single-part result).  So we add an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">   extra one to guarantee enough space whilst multiplying.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa2356c8c049af2c0e4a5e4892e5a48d1"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa2356c8c049af2c0e4a5e4892e5a48d1">maxExponent</a> = 16383;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4fc0551303dc77bf30c5487aea4b4c5e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4fc0551303dc77bf30c5487aea4b4c5e">maxPrecision</a> = 113;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1733"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1734"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Did the significand increment overflow?  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1735"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (omsb == (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) semantics-&gt;precision + 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1736"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Renormalize by incrementing the exponent and shifting our</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1737"><Highlight kind="comment">         significand right one.  However if we already have the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1738"><Highlight kind="comment">         maximum exponent we overflow to infinity.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1739"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (exponent == semantics-&gt;maxExponent)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1740"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Invoke overflow handling with a rounding mode that will guarantee</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1741"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that the result gets turned into the correct infinity representation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1742"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is needed instead of just setting the category to infinity to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1743"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// account for 8-bit floating point types that have no inf, only NaN.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1744"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> handleOverflow(sign ? <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#aa354c1a394c0cd817844d448c89fd810">rmTowardNegative</a> : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a4ad7360aee37bff01f6dc3a3311f1c98">rmTowardPositive</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1745"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1746"><Highlight kind="normal">      shiftSignificandRight(1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1747"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1748"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a078e0c7d94556af84b4e2264db4a1a84">opInexact</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1750"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1751"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The all-ones values is an overflow if NaN is all ones. If NaN is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (semantics-&gt;nonFiniteBehavior == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab0b9d2d0eaa773cc9476c1cd7a728b3eac71bc68340af8790b07db8f234d89fa6">fltNonfiniteBehavior::NanOnly</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal">        semantics-&gt;nanEncoding == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a421c6b20238e6e6585270538188f15b9">fltNanEncoding::AllOnes</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal">        exponent == semantics-&gt;maxExponent &amp;&amp; isSignificandAllOnes())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> handleOverflow(rounding&#95;mode);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; The normal case - we were and are not denormal, and any</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="comment">     significand increment above didn&#39;t overflow.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (omsb == semantics-&gt;precision)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1764"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; We have a non-zero denormal.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1767"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Canonicalize zeroes.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2182"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First handle the special cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2186"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2187"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2189"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure the current value is less than twice the denom. If the addition</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2190"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// did not succeed (an overflow has happened), which means that the finite</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2191"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value we currently posses must be less than twice the denom (as we are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// using the same semantics).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#aaf97dd1294231bc3dd4d6e414f703baa">IEEEFloat</a> P2 = rhs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (P2.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a6aa059590a2b13eab35037154841e81c">add</a>(rhs, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#ac3a5f03151dfa723fbbf0afab1cdd7ba">rmNearestTiesToEven</a>) == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a08b873c60c5bdb77993fbe575d54ad29">mod</a>(P2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Lets work with absolute numbers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#aaf97dd1294231bc3dd4d6e414f703baa">IEEEFloat</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a> = rhs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>.sign = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><Highlight kind="normal">  sign = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To calculate the remainder we use the following scheme.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The remainder is defained as follows:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// remainder = numer - rquot &#42; denom = x - r &#42; p</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Where r is the result of: x/p, rounded toward the nearest integral value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (with halfway cases rounded toward the even number).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently, (after x mod 2p):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// r is the number of 2p&#39;s present inside x, which is inherently, an even</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of p&#39;s.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We may split the remaining calculation into 4 options:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x &lt; 0.5p then we round to the nearest number with is 0, and are done.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2220"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x == 0.5p then we round to the nearest even number which is 0, and we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   are done as well.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2222"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if 0.5p &lt; x &lt; p then we round to nearest number which is 1, and we have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2223"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   to subtract 1p at least once.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2224"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x &gt;= p then we must subtract p at least once, as x must be a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2225"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   remainder.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2226"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2227"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By now, we were done, or we added 1 to r, which in turn, now an odd number.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2228"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2229"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can now split the remaining calculation to the following 3 options:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2230"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x &lt; 0.5p then we round to the nearest number with is 0, and are done.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2231"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x == 0.5p then we round to the nearest even number. As r is odd, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2232"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   must round up to the next even number. so we must subtract p once more.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2233"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// - if x &gt; 0.5p (and inherently x &lt; p) then we must round r up to the next</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2330"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2331"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Post-multiplication sign, before addition.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2332"><Highlight kind="normal">  sign ^= multiplicand.sign;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2333"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2344"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a77eed59f396aed6c72b0a405d9861cfe">opStatus</a>) (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> | <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a078e0c7d94556af84b4e2264db4a1a84">opInexact</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2345"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; If two numbers add (exactly) to zero, IEEE 754 decrees it is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><Highlight kind="comment">       positive zero unless rounding to minus infinity, except that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><Highlight kind="comment">       adding two like-signed zeroes gives that zero.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (category == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a582a70a1f361d031912bc4f4738936b6">fcZero</a> &amp;&amp; !(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> &amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#abbeaca18fca881e94be0a95c16f0c35d">opUnderflow</a>) &amp;&amp; sign != addend.sign) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><Highlight kind="normal">      sign = (rounding&#95;mode == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#aa354c1a394c0cd817844d448c89fd810">rmTowardNegative</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (semantics-&gt;nanEncoding == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af14335020a68db7b9f722810e4a05180a062a7e7a762600c65f4435eb53a6f17a">fltNanEncoding::NegativeZero</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><Highlight kind="normal">        sign = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2355"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = multiplySpecials(multiplicand);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2357"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; FS can only be opOK or opInvalidOp.  There is no more work</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2358"><Highlight kind="comment">       to do in the latter case.  The IEEE-754R standard says it is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2359"><Highlight kind="comment">       implementation-defined in this case whether, if ADDEND is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2360"><Highlight kind="comment">       quiet NaN, we raise invalid op; this implementation does so.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2361"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2362"><Highlight kind="comment">       If we need to do the addition we can do so with normal</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2363"><Highlight kind="comment">       precision.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2364"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2365"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = addOrSubtract(addend, rounding&#95;mode, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2366"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2367"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a77eed59f396aed6c72b0a405d9861cfe">opStatus</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#ac55b5d9082d1c4466113b3223464759f">isInfinity</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;IEEE Std 754-2008 6.1&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2377"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The behavior of infinity in floating-point arithmetic is derived from the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// limiting cases of real arithmetic with operands of arbitrarily</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2379"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// large magnitude, when such a limit exists.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2380"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2381"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Operations on infinite operands are usually exact and therefore signal no</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2382"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exceptions ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2383"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2384"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2385"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a3abc0e386496d9bed38ce2836e8129ea">isNaN</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2386"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#accc978f15db9b1b2b8e3ac171cbac4e3">isSignaling</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2387"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;IEEE Std 754-2008 6.2&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2388"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Under default exception handling, any operation signaling an invalid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2389"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operation exception and for which a floating-point result is to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2390"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// delivered shall deliver a quiet NaN.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2391"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a639825b8b65055547446e8fab3709b6f">makeQuiet</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;IEEE Std 754-2008 6.2&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2393"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Signaling NaNs shall be reserved operands that, under default exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2394"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handling, signal the invalid operation exception(see 7.2) for every</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2395"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// general-computational and signaling-computational operation except for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2396"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the conversions described in 5.12.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2397"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a75267ed3af879b99e5fa13b94a5383ca">opInvalidOp</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2398"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2399"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;IEEE Std 754-2008 6.2&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2400"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For an operation with quiet NaN inputs, other than maximum and minimum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2401"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operations, if a floating-point result is to be delivered the result</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2402"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// shall be a quiet NaN which should be one of the input NaNs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2403"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2404"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Every general-computational and quiet-computational operation involving</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2405"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one or more input NaNs, none of them signaling, shall signal no</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2406"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exception, except fusedMultiplyAdd might signal the invalid operation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2407"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exception(see 7.2).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2408"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2409"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2410"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2411"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2412"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#ac87cc1729c30fb26cbdf03b618bfb43a">isZero</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2413"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;IEEE Std 754-2008 6.3&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2414"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ... the sign of the result of conversions, the quantize operation, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2415"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// roundToIntegral operations, and the roundToIntegralExact(see 5.3.1) is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2416"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the sign of the first or only operand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2417"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2418"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2419"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2420"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the exponent is large enough, we know that this value is already</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2421"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// integral, and the arithmetic below would potentially cause it to saturate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to +/-Inf.  Bail out early instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (exponent + 1 &gt;= (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a6530cd829b7e8d4df2c29d950039961e">APFloat::semanticsPrecision</a>(&#42;semantics))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2424"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2425"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The algorithm here is quite simple: we add 2^(p-1), where p is the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// precision of our format, and then subtract it back off again.  The choice</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2428"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of rounding modes for the addition/subtraction determines the rounding mode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2429"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for our integral rounding as well.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2430"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NOTE: When the input value is negative, we do subtraction followed by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2431"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addition instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2432"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> IntegerConstant(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afb65eef479f0473d0fe1666b80155237">NextPowerOf2</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a6530cd829b7e8d4df2c29d950039961e">APFloat::semanticsPrecision</a>(&#42;semantics)),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2433"><Highlight kind="normal">                        1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2434"><Highlight kind="normal">  IntegerConstant &lt;&lt;= <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/apfloatbase/#a6530cd829b7e8d4df2c29d950039961e">APFloat::semanticsPrecision</a>(&#42;semantics) - 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2435"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#aaf97dd1294231bc3dd4d6e414f703baa">IEEEFloat</a> MagicConstant(&#42;semantics);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2436"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> = MagicConstant.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a135db5ce97b04855e9e8f44d26d30d43">convertFromAPInt</a>(IntegerConstant, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2437"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#ac3a5f03151dfa723fbbf0afab1cdd7ba">rmNearestTiesToEven</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2438"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs">fs</a> == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a58e11ed4a62124e2cc8d96c1417a1d91">opOK</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2439"><Highlight kind="normal">  MagicConstant.sign = sign;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2440"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2441"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Preserve the input sign so that we can handle the case of zero result</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2442"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// correctly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Handle the quick cases.  First the case of no significant digits,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3107"><Highlight kind="comment">     i.e. zero, and then exponents that are obviously too large or too</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3108"><Highlight kind="comment">     small.  Writing L for log 10 / log 2, a number d.ddddd&#42;10^exp</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3112"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3113"><Highlight kind="comment">     and definitely underflows to zero where</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3114"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3115"><Highlight kind="comment">           (exp + 1) &#42; L &lt;= minExponent - precision</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3116"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3117"><Highlight kind="comment">     With integer arithmetic the tightest bounds for L are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3118"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3119"><Highlight kind="comment">           93/28 &lt; L &lt; 196/59            &#91; numerator &lt;= 256 &#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3120"><Highlight kind="comment">           42039/12655 &lt; L &lt; 28738/8651  &#91; numerator &lt;= 65536 &#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3121"><Highlight kind="comment">  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3122"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3123"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Test if we have a zero number allowing for strings with no null terminators</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and zero decimals with non-zero exponents.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We computed firstSigDigit by ignoring all zeros and dots. Thus if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// D-&gt;firstSigDigit equals str.end(), every digit must be a zero and there can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3128"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be at most one dot. On the other hand, if we have a zero with a non-zero</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3129"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exponent, then we know that D.firstSigDigit will be non-numeric.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a>.firstSigDigit == str.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref/#a996c7ca3dd6843ba5d55a7c217770270">end</a>() || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa39e32371bddaff303bf990d69db79bf">decDigitValue</a>(&#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a>.firstSigDigit) &gt;= 10U) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3324"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3325"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Write out a hexadecimal representation of the floating point value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3326"><Highlight kind="comment">   to DST, which must be of sufficient size, in the C99 form</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3327"><Highlight kind="comment">   &#91;-&#93;0xh.hhhhp&#91;+-&#93;d.  Return the number of characters written,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3328"><Highlight kind="comment">   excluding the terminating NUL.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3329"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3330"><Highlight kind="comment">   If UPPERCASE, the output is in upper case, otherwise in lower case.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3331"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3332"><Highlight kind="comment">   HEXDIGITS digits appear altogether, rounding the value if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3333"><Highlight kind="comment">   necessary.  If HEXDIGITS is 0, the minimal precision to display the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3334"><Highlight kind="comment">   number precisely is used instead.  If nothing would appear after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3335"><Highlight kind="comment">   the decimal point it is suppressed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3336"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3337"><Highlight kind="comment">   The decimal exponent is always printed and has at least one digit.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3338"><Highlight kind="comment">   Zero values display an exponent of zero.  Infinities and NaNs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3339"><Highlight kind="comment">   appear as &quot;infinity&quot; or &quot;nan&quot; respectively.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3340"><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3341"><Highlight kind="comment">   The above rules are as specified by C99.  There is ambiguity about</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3342"><Highlight kind="comment">   what the leading hexadecimal digit should be.  This implementation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3343"><Highlight kind="comment">   uses whatever is necessary so that the exponent is displayed as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3344"><Highlight kind="comment">   stored.  This implies the exponent will fall within the IEEE format</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3345"><Highlight kind="comment">   range, and the leading hexadecimal digit will be 0 (for denormals),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3346"><Highlight kind="comment">   1 (normal numbers) or 2 (normal numbers rounded-away-from-zero with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3347"><Highlight kind="comment">   any other digits zero).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3348"><Highlight kind="comment">&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3349" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a032bb65d786b0169e342f753901000e0"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/detail/ieeefloat/#a032bb65d786b0169e342f753901000e0">IEEEFloat::convertToHexString</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;dst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> hexDigits,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3394"><Highlight kind="comment">   hexadecimal digits.  If HEXDIGITS is zero the minimum number of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3395"><Highlight kind="comment">   digits necessary to print the value precisely is output.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3396"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;IEEEFloat::convertNormalToHexString(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;dst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> hexDigits,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3399"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a>, valueBits, shift, partsCount, outputDigits;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3407"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3408"><Highlight kind="normal">  roundUp = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3410"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3411"><Highlight kind="normal">  significand = significandParts();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3412"><Highlight kind="normal">  partsCount = partCount();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3413"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; 3 because the first digit only uses the single integer bit, so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3415"><Highlight kind="comment">     we have 3 virtual zero most-significant-bits.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3421"><Highlight kind="normal">  outputDigits = (valueBits - significandLSB () + 3) / 4;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3422"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; hexDigits of zero means use the required number for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3424"><Highlight kind="comment">     precision.  Otherwise, see if we are truncating.  If we are,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3425"><Highlight kind="comment">     find out if we need to round away from zero.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (hexDigits) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3435"><Highlight kind="normal">      roundUp = roundAwayFromZero(rounding&#95;mode, fraction, bits);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3436"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3437"><Highlight kind="normal">    outputDigits = hexDigits;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3438"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3439"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3440"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Write the digits consecutively, and start writing in the location</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3445"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a> = (valueBits + <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a6046f2430fdd4c273218e51e4b9bdaf3">integerPartWidth</a> - 1) / <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a6046f2430fdd4c273218e51e4b9bdaf3">integerPartWidth</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3446"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3447"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (outputDigits &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3448"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#afa56d865e527ea20a3023a93a825fe6d">integerPart</a> part;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3449"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3450"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; Put the most significant integerPartWidth bits in &quot;part&quot;.  &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3457"><Highlight kind="normal">      part |= significand&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1772fd431decccb7926d484ea223db7">count</a> - 1&#93; &gt;&gt; (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#a6046f2430fdd4c273218e51e4b9bdaf3">integerPartWidth</a> - shift);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3461"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4293"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set FormatPrecision if zero.  We want to do this before we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4294"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// truncate trailing zeros, as those are part of the precision.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4295"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!FormatPrecision) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4296"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We use enough digits so the number can be round-tripped back to an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4297"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// APFloat. The formula comes from &quot;How to Print Floating-Point Numbers</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4298"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Accurately&quot; by Steele and White.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4299"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Using a formula based purely on the precision is conservative;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4300"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we can print fewer digits depending on the actual value being printed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4301"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4302"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FormatPrecision = 2 + floor(significandBits / lg&#95;2(10))</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4303"><Highlight kind="normal">      FormatPrecision = 2 + semanticsPrecision &#42; 59 / 196;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4304"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4305"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4306"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ignore trailing binary zeros.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4307"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> trailingZeros = significand.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a83c7c9008ba213687483b60a658b4a13">countr&#95;zero</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4308"><Highlight kind="normal">    exp += trailingZeros;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4309"><Highlight kind="normal">    significand.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#af338e23a90c301183968435e80cd6a27">lshrInPlace</a>(trailingZeros);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4310"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4311"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Change the exponent from 2^e to 10^e.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4312"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (exp == 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4313"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Nothing to do.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4314"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (exp &gt; 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4315"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Just shift left.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4316"><Highlight kind="normal">      significand = significand.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a1dc76cc8bf703e6ada68bededcbb9573">zext</a>(semanticsPrecision + exp);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4317"><Highlight kind="normal">      significand &lt;&lt;= exp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4318"><Highlight kind="normal">      exp = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4319"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42; exp &lt; 0 &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4320"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> texp = -exp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4322"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We transform this using the identity:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4323"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (N)(2^-e) == (N)(5^e)(10^-e)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4324"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This means we have to multiply N (the significand) by 5^e.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4325"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To avoid overflow, we have to operate on numbers large</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4326"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// enough to store N &#42; 5^e:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4327"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   log2(N &#42; 5^e) == log2(N) + e &#42; log2(5)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4328"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                 &lt;= semantics-&gt;precision + e &#42; 137 / 59</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4329"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   (log&#95;2(5) ~ 2.321928 &lt; 2.322034 ~ 137/59)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4330"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4331"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> precision = semanticsPrecision + (137 &#42; texp + 136) / 59;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4332"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4333"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Multiply significand by 5^e.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4334"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   N &#42; 5^0101 == N &#42; 5^(1&#42;1) &#42; 5^(0&#42;2) &#42; 5^(1&#42;4) &#42; 5^(0&#42;8)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4335"><Highlight kind="normal">      significand = significand.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a1dc76cc8bf703e6ada68bededcbb9573">zext</a>(precision);</Highlight></CodeLine>
